confit definition: meat (as goose, duck, or pork) that has been cooked and preserved in its own fat.
Maceration (food) - In food preparation, maceration is softening or breaking into pieces using a liquid.
Confit byaldi - Confit byaldi is a variation on the traditional French dish ratatouille by French chef Michel Guérard.
Confit is a generic term for various kinds of food that have been immersed in a substance for both flavour and preservation.

wiki.text:
'Confit' (French, pronounced or in English "con-fee") is a generic term for
various kinds of food that have been immersed in oil (never to exceed 185°F) or
sugar water. Sealed and stored in a cool, dark place, confit can last for
several months. Confit is one of the oldest ways to preserve food, and is a
speciality of southwestern France.
wiki.title: Confit
